body_html: I've only had a quick look but it seems rather ad-hoc (implemented in MPI-Python and run single-node TF in it). Plus it is certainly not the same as what appears in the TF paper. I believe what we are talking about would be a truly remote API that support sync/async communication and send/recv graph partitioning, or pretty much everything in the current gRPC runtime.

body: I've only had a quick look but it seems rather ad-hoc (implemented in MPI-Python and run single-node TF in it). Plus it is certainly not the same as what appears in the TF paper. I believe what we are talking about would be a truly remote API that support sync/async communication and send/recv graph partitioning, or pretty much everything in the current gRPC runtime.
